data.title: Ad about USS Liberty aired twice on Dan Bongino radio program
data.meta_description: A 30-second spot was aired on the Bongino radio show, part of a series of radio & TV ads reaching 23 million Americans throughout the US
data.text:
This is the latest in a series of radio and television ads that have reached a combined total of approximately 23 million Americans throughout the United States. The ads are airing on programs whose audiences are particularly known for patriotic viewpoints and support for military veterans. In addition, a YouTube ad has been viewed more than 1.1 million times…

By If Americans Knew staff

A 30-second spot by If Americans Knew was broadcast on the Dan Bongino radio show mid-day on Tuesday and Wednesday, Nov. 15 and 16. The ad directs listeners to JusticeForLiberty.org, which provides survivors’ testimonies and extensive information about Israel’s attempt to sink a U.S. Navy ship, the USS Liberty.

Our ad begins at 0:35

The Dan Bongino Show is one of the top talk radio programs in the U.S. It airs on more than 300 affiliate stations across the country and is heard by approximately 8.5 million listeners each week. Bongino is a former secret service officer, author, and conservative commentator.

Previous Radio & TV ads on mainstream programs

The current ads follow similar ads which ran from September 12th through October 7th on 450 radio stations around the country (list below) and were heard by 13.8 million listeners.

Those ads were preceded by a number of television ads broadcast on the most-listened to TV news programs in the U.S., with a combined viewership of 8.8 million Americans.

Justice For Liberty on Youtube

Aside from traditional media, If Americans Knew has also been running an ad on YouTube. As of Nov. 18th, the ad had been viewed well over 1.1 million times.
